title: Texas Firm Recalls Pork Products Due To Misbranding and Undeclared Allergens
summary: WASHINGTON, December 27, 2014 Garcia Foods, Inc., a San Antonio, Texas establishment, is recalling approximately 190,450 pounds of pork products due to misbranding and undeclared allergens, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The products may contain peanuts, known...
impacted_products: 12-oz. vacuum-packed, raw pork sausage link pieces of iHILL COUNTRY FARE CHORIZO.”
8-oz. vacuum-packed, raw pork sausage chubs of iHILL COUNTRY FARE CHORIZO.”
